Role Based Access

App authentication is used to keep intruders out of a Blinky-LiteTM control system which is very important. However, making sure that authenticated users do not do something unintentionally is probably more critical. In Blinky-LiteTM, this accomplished with role-based-access. Most control systems implement only reading and setting privileges but with Blinky-LiteTM is possible to restrict not only what actions are permitted by what applications are allowed to be accessed. In addition, because Blinky-LiteTM groups data into message trays, it is also possible to restrict which data a user has access to as well. Below shows an example user profile for Blinky-LiteTM role-based-access.
